text: Name _____Paul Briery_____________ Temple College Fall DC Assignment #1 VNSG 1460: Clinical – LVN Training II Round to the nearest tenth. All answers are per dose. The doctor has ordered Hydrochlorothiazide 12.5 mg for your client to take every morning. The pharmacy dispenses 25 mg tablets. How many tablets would you give? ________2______25/12.5=2______ Desired:	Micro-K 16 mEq po stat Available:	Micro-K 8 mEq capsules Give: ______2___16/8=2___________ You are scheduled to give your patient Synthroid 0.1 mg po every a.m. You look in the client’s medication drawer and the pharmacy has dispensed Synthroid 50 mcg tablets. How many tablets would you give?____2____0.1/0.05 =2____________ Desired:	Keflex 500 mg po Available:	Keflex 250 mg/5 mL Give: _10mL____500/250=2____5*2=10___ Desired:	KCL 30 mEq Available:	KCL 20 mEq/5 mL Give: __7.5mL____30/20=1.5_5*1.5= 7.5___ Round to the nearest whole number. Your client has just come out of surgery having had an appendectomy. Post op orders: Lactated Ringers 500 mL to run over 2 hours. Drop factor: 10 gtt/mL How many mL/hr? _____250_____500/2=250__ How many gtt/min? _____42___60/10=6 250/6=41.6____________ Your client is to receive 150 mL of IV fluids over 45 minutes. Drop Factor: 20 gtt/mL How many mL/hr? ___200_150/3=50 150+50=200_______ How many gtt/min? ____67___150/45=3.33*20=6.6_____________ 0.45% Normal Saline 600 mL to infuse over 3 hours. Drop Factor: 15 gtt/mL How many mL/hr? ___200__600/3=200_______________ How many gtt/min? ___50___60/15=4__200/4=50____________ IVPB 100 mL to infuse in 30 minutes. Drop factor is 10 gtt/mL How many mL/hr? __200____60/30=2__100*2=200______ How many gtt/min? ___33____60/10=6__200/6=33.33______ A fluid challenge is ordered for your client in hypovolemic shock. The client needs 500 mL of Normal Saline over 1 hour. Drop Factor: 15 gtt/mL How many mL/hr? _500____500/1=500_________ How many gtt/min? __125____60/15=4_500/4=_125____________
